channel.title: ?Steps For Hosting with a MODEM 317? HELP
channel.description: okay so i have 1. the source and client kevenscape... 2. no-ip duc 3.jdk 4.port forwared (although i dont have to) 4. changed ip (maybe i dont know what to change the ip to??) 5. any help besides "it cant be done" (caus i know it can..) would be much appreciated!

item.title: ?Steps For Hosting with a MODEM 317? HELP
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

and if he’s going to give it so other people can connect to his IP all he does is change the P in client or egui.java to his serverip

Read full topic
item.source: ?Steps For Hosting with a MODEM 317? HELP

item.title: ?Steps For Hosting with a MODEM 317? HELP
item.dc:creator: @Coldkill Coldkill
item.description:
@Coldkill wrote:

saying you shouldn’t need to portforward (although some modems require it)

All you should have to do is:

Go to your client.java or gui.java or egui.java (wherever your severip is) and search for “serverip =” and change the “127.0.0.1” or “0.0.0.0” to your no-ip…

compile…open your no-ip duc run it…run the server…run the client and test (should work)

Read full topic
item.source: ?Steps For Hosting with a MODEM 317? HELP

item.title: ?Steps For Hosting with a MODEM 317? HELP
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

umm… in your client, set it to 127.0.0.1, but if you’re going to give it out to other people change it to your no-ip IP (yourservername.no-ip.biz) but keep it when YOU try to connect to 127.0.0.1.

Read full topic

item.title: ?Steps For Hosting with a MODEM 317? HELP
item.dc:creator: @zaknai zaknai
item.description:
@zaknai wrote:

Okay… but i really dont want to use hamachi.
in my clinet/gui/egui/ (whatever) what ip would i change that to using no-ip
and my server what ip would i change that to… no-ip? or my default gateway? or my acual computer ip?
and… anything else?
Thank you ive been trying to do this for days now… =)

Read full topic

item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

that’s just in his client, he meant getting others to play… i think that what you posted should be OK, did’t it work or something? since you don’t have a router you don’t need portforward… and if it doesn’t work maybe you can try hamachi servers

item.source: ?Steps For Hosting with a MODEM 317? HELP

item.title: ?Steps For Hosting with a MODEM 317? HELP
item.dc:creator: @needhelpplease needhelpplease
item.description:
@needhelpplease wrote:

ok , well in the client goto client.java
search “no-ip” if nothing comes up search"127.0" if nothing search “0.0.0”
if it comes up with kevin-scape.no-ip.biz or something, replace with 127.0.0.1
if it comes up with 127.0.0.1 leave it run ur server and run ur client it should work.
if it comes up with 0.0.0.0 leave it its fine.

do this in “Client.java” and “gui.java” or “egui.java”.
pm me for any more help if needed.

Read full topic
